tools

Class SortAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.SortAlgorithm

  • public class SortAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to sort Dicoms.
    Author:
    dridder_local

      Returns the information, if there was a problem with the permission.

      Method, to stop the Sort of another Thread.
      void useSubfolders(boolean b)
      The boolean value subfolders contains the information, whether the different angel of the scans are sorted in subfolders in the protocol name directorys or the different angel are save as the protocol name with a certain praefix.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SortAlgorithm

        public SortAlgorithm()
        This is the default construktur. This construktur setting the following defaults value:

        - subfolders = false

        - image digits = 5

        - protocol_digits = 3

        Take a look in the Java-doc of the setter methods of these values for more informations.

      • SortAlgorithm

        public SortAlgorithm(boolean subfolders)
        This construktur contains the following default setter: - image digits = 5

        - protocol digits = 3

        Take a look in the Java-doc of the setter methods of these values for more informations.

        Parameters:
        subfolders -

      • SortAlgorithm

        public SortAlgorithm(boolean subfolders,
             int protocol_digits)
        This construktur contains the following default setter: - protocol digits = 3

    • Method Detail

      • setKeepImageName

        public void setKeepImageName(boolean keepit)
        This method is used, to decide, wether the Names of the files gonna be changened to their Image Number or if their keep their names.

      • setPrintStream

        public void setPrintStream(java.io.PrintStream out)
        The setPrinStream method can be used, to catch the output or the place, where it is printed.

      • setImgDigits

        public void setImgDigits(int i)
        The imgDigits contains the information, how many digits are used to save the image number of a DICOM in the file name. If the image number of a DICOM is larger than the imgDigits number, than the image number of the DICOM is taken.

      • setProtocolDigits

        public void setProtocolDigits(int i)
        The protocolDigits contains the Information how many digits are used at a special position. If subfolders is true, than protocolDigits contains the information for the number of digits for the subfolder of a protocol name folder. Else, the protocolDigits contains the information, how many digits are used as a Praefix of a protocol folder.

      • useSubfolders

        public void useSubfolders(boolean b)
        The boolean value subfolders contains the information, whether the different angel of the scans are sorted in subfolders in the protocol name directorys or the different angel are save as the protocol name with a certain praefix.

      • setFilesOptionCopy

        public void setFilesOptionCopy()
        Sets the Filetransferoption to copy.

      • setFilesOptionMove

        public void setFilesOptionMove()
        Sets the Filetransferoption to move.

      • setCreateNiftis

        public void setCreateNiftis(boolean createniftis)
        Defines, if the dicoms transefered as a dicom or as a nifti.

      • gotStopped

        public boolean gotStopped()
        This tells you, if someone forced the SortAlgorithm to stop the sort, with the stopSort() method.

      • getPermissionProblem

        public boolean getPermissionProblem()
        Returns the information, if there was a problem with the permission.
        Returns:
        true, if there was a Problem to transfer/copy the Files; false else

      • stopSort

        public void stopSort()
        Method, to stop the Sort of another Thread.

      • searchAndSortIn

        public boolean searchAndSortIn(java.lang.String searchin,
                      java.lang.String sortInDir)
        This method searching in the path "searchin" for DICOMs and subfolders, which contains DICOMs. These DICOMs are sorted in the value "sortInDir". If "sortInDir" not exists, it gonna be created. To specify the behaivor of this method, you can use the setter methods.
        Parameters:
        searchin - The Folder, where the Algorithm search for DICOMs.
        sortInDir - The Folder, where the Algorithm move and sort the DICOMs.
